company.name: Tru Communication, Inc.
company.business_description: Tru Communication, Inc. (dba TCPrinting.net) provides printing services such as copying, binding, and scanning of documents.

case_info.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

complaint.factual_background: Tru Communication, Inc., doing business as TCPrinting.net, is a California-based printing services company that published privacy policies on its website falsely claiming participation in the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield framework. Privacy Shield is a mechanism allowing U.S. companies to lawfully transfer personal data from the EU to the United States, requiring companies to self-certify compliance with Privacy Shield Principles to the U.S. Department of Commerce. Although Respondent initiated an application for Privacy Shield certification, it never completed the necessary steps to actually participate in the framework. By publicly claiming it would remain 'compliant and current with Privacy Shield at all times,' the company deceived consumers and businesses about its data protection practices, in violation of Section 5(a) of the FTC Act.

representations_made.description: Claimed the company would remain compliant and current with the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield framework at all times, implying active participation in the framework
representations_made.quoted_text: TC Printing will remain compliant and current with Privacy Shield at all times.

representations_made.description: Represented, expressly or by implication, that Respondent is a participant in the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield framework
representations_made.quoted_text: 12. Through the means described in Paragraph 11, Respondent represents, expressly or by implication, that it is a participant in the EU-U.S Privacy Shield framework.

counts.title: False Representation of EU-U.S. Privacy Shield Participation
counts.representation: Respondent represented, expressly or by implication, that it is a participant in the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield framework, stating it would remain 'compliant and current with Privacy Shield at all times'
counts.fact: Although Respondent initiated an application to Commerce for Privacy Shield certification, it did not complete the steps necessary to participate in the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield framework and was not certified
counts.conclusion: Therefore, the representation set forth in Paragraph 12 is false and misleading, and constitutes deceptive acts or practices in violation of Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

definitions.Respondent: Tru Communication, Inc. dba TCPrinting.net, a corporation and its successors and assigns.

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Participation in Privacy or Security Programs
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent, in any manner, the extent to which it participates in any government or self-regulatory privacy or security program, including the EU-U.S. and Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield frameworks.

requirements.description: Must not misrepresent membership, certification, endorsement, or participation in any privacy or security program sponsored by a government or self-regulatory/standard-setting organization, including but not limited to the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield framework and the Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield framework
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS ORDERED that Respondent and its officers, agents, employees, and attorneys, and all other persons in active concert or participation with any of them, who receive actual notice of this order, whether acting directly or indirectly, in connection with the advertising, marketing, promotion, offering for sale, or sale of any product or service must not misrepresent in any manner, expressly or by implication, the extent to which Respondent is a member of, adheres to, complies with, is certified by, is endorsed by, or otherwise participates in any privacy or security program sponsored by a government or any self-regulatory or standard-setting organization, including but not limited to the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield framework and the Swiss - U.S. Privacy Shield framework.

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must acknowledge receipt of the Order itself, deliver copies to relevant personnel and successor entities, and obtain signed acknowledgments from each recipient.

requirements.description: Within 10 days after the effective date, Respondent must submit to the Commission an acknowledgment of receipt of this Order
requirements.quoted_text: A. Respondent, within 10 days after the effective date of this Order, must submit to the Commission an acknowledgment of receipt of this Order.

requirements.description: For 20 years after the issuance date, Respondent must deliver a copy of this Order to all principals, officers, directors, LLC managers and members, employees, agents, and representatives with relevant responsibilities, and any successor business entities — within 10 days for current personnel, and before assuming responsibilities for all others
requirements.quoted_text: B. For twenty (20) years after the issuance date of this Order, Respondent must deliver a copy of this Order to: (1) all principals, officers, directors, and LLC managers and members; (2) all employees, agents, and representatives with responsibilities related to the subject matter of the Order; and (3) any business entity resulting from any change in Page 2 of 5 structure as set forth in the Provision titled Compliance Report and Notices. Delivery must occur within ten (10) days after the effective date of this Order for current personnel. For all others, delivery must occur before they assume their responsibilities.
requirements.deadline: 10 days (current personnel); before assuming responsibilities (future personnel)

requirements.description: From each individual or entity to which a copy of the Order was delivered, Respondent must obtain a signed and dated acknowledgment of receipt within 30 days
requirements.quoted_text: C. From each individual or entity to which Respondent delivered a copy of this Order, Respondent must obtain, within thirty (30) days, a signed and dated acknowledgment of receipt of this Order.

provisions.title: Compliance Report and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit an initial sworn compliance report within 60 days, and thereafter submit sworn notices within 14 days of any material changes in contact information, corporate structure, or bankruptcy filings.

requirements.description: Within 60 days of the issuance date, submit a sworn compliance report identifying designated contacts, all businesses, describing activities, detailing compliance with each provision, and providing copies of acknowledgments obtained
requirements.quoted_text: A. Sixty (60) days after the issuance date of this Order, Respondent must submit a compliance report, sworn under penalty of perjury, in which Respondent must: (a) identify the primary physical, postal, and email address and telephone number, as designated points of contact, which representatives of the Commission, may use to communicate with Respondent; (b) identify all of Respondent’s businesses by all of their names, telephone numbers, and physical, postal, email, and Internet addresses; (c) describe the activities of each business; (d) describe in detail whether and how Respondent is in compliance with each Provision of this Order; and (e) provide a copy of each Acknowledgment of the Order obtained pursuant to this Order, unless previously submitted to the Commission.

requirements.description: Within 14 days of any change in a designated point of contact or in the structure of Respondent or any entity it owns or controls that may affect compliance, submit a sworn compliance notice
requirements.quoted_text: B. Respondent must submit a compliance notice, sworn under penalty of perjury, within 14 days of any change in the following: (1) any designated point of contact; or (2) the structure of Respondent or any entity that Respondent has any ownership interest in or controls directly or indirectly that may affect compliance obligations arising under this Order, including: creation, merger, sale, or dissolution of the entity or any subsidiary, parent, or affiliate that engages in any acts or practices subject to this Order.

requirements.description: Within 14 days of filing, submit notice of any bankruptcy petition, insolvency proceeding, or similar proceeding by or against Respondent
requirements.quoted_text: C. Respondent must submit notice of the filing of any bankruptcy petition, insolvency proceeding, or similar proceeding by or against Respondent within 14 days of its filing.

requirements.description: All sworn submissions must be true and accurate and comply with 28 U.S.C. § 1746, including the specified declaration language, date, signatory's full name, title, and signature
requirements.quoted_text: D. Any submission to the Commission required by this Order to be sworn under penalty of perjury must be true and accurate and comply with 28 U.S.C. § 1746, such as by concluding: “I declare under penalty of perjury under the laws of the United States of America that the foregoing is true and correct. Executed on: _____” and supplying the date, signatory’s full name, title (if applicable), and signature.

requirements.description: Unless otherwise directed in writing, all submissions must be emailed to Debrief@ftc.gov or sent by overnight courier to the FTC's Associate Director of Enforcement, with the subject line beginning: In re Tru Communication, Inc. dba TCPrinting.net, FTC File No. 1723171
requirements.quoted_text: E. Unless otherwise directed by a Commission representative in writing, all submissions to the Commission pursuant to this Order must be emailed to Debrief@ftc.gov or sent by overnight courier (not the U.S. Postal Service) to: Associate Director of Enforcement, Page 3 of 5 Bureau of Consumer Protection, Federal Trade Commission, 600 Pennsylvania Avenue, N.W., Washington, D.C. 20580. The subject line must begin: In re Tru Communication, Inc. dba TCPrinting.net, FTC File No. 1723171.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must create and retain for five years specified categories of business records for a period of twenty years from the issuance date of the Order.

requirements.description: Create and retain for 5 years accounting records showing revenues from all goods or services sold
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Respondent must create certain records for twenty (20) years after the issuance date of the Order, and retain each such record for 5 (five) years. Specifically, Respondent must create and retain the following records: A. accounting records showing the revenues from all goods or services sold;

requirements.description: Create and retain personnel records for each person providing services, including name, addresses, telephone numbers, job title or position, dates of service, and reason for termination if applicable
requirements.quoted_text: B. personnel records showing, for each person providing services, whether as an employee or otherwise, that person’s: name; addresses; telephone numbers; job title or position; dates of service; and (if applicable) the reason for termination;

requirements.description: Create and retain all records necessary to demonstrate full compliance with each provision of this Order, including all submissions to the Commission
requirements.quoted_text: C. all records necessary to demonstrate full compliance with each provision of this Order, including all submissions to the Commission; and

requirements.description: Create and retain a copy of each unique advertisement, promotional material, or other marketing material making any representation subject to this Order, and all materials relied upon in making the representation
requirements.quoted_text: D. a copy of each unique advertisement, promotional material, or other marketing material making any representation subject to this Order, and all materials that were relied upon in making the representation.

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission is authorized to monitor Respondent's compliance through requests for reports and records, direct communications with Respondent and its personnel, and undercover investigative means.

requirements.description: Within 10 days of receipt of a written request from a Commission representative, Respondent must submit additional compliance reports or other requested information under penalty of perjury, and produce records for inspection and copying
requirements.quoted_text: A. Within ten (10) days of receipt of a written request from a representative of the Commission, Respondent must: submit additional compliance reports or other requested information, which must be sworn under penalty of perjury, and produce records for inspection and copying.

requirements.description: Respondent must permit Commission representatives to communicate directly with Respondent and to interview any affiliated individual who has agreed to an interview, with counsel permitted to be present
requirements.quoted_text: B. For matters concerning this Order, representatives of the Commission are authorized to communicate directly with Respondent. Respondent must permit representatives of the Commission to interview anyone affiliated with Respondent who has agreed to such an interview. The interviewee may have counsel present.

requirements.description: The Commission may use all other lawful means, including posing as consumers, suppliers, or other individuals or entities, without identification or prior notice, and may use compulsory process under Sections 9 and 20 of the FTC Act
requirements.quoted_text: C. The Commission may use all other lawful means, including posing through its representatives as consumers, suppliers, or other individuals or entities, to Respondent or any individual or entity affiliated with Respondent, without the necessity of identification or prior notice. Nothing in this Order limits the Commission’s lawful use of compulsory process, pursuant to Sections 9 and 20 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 49, 57b-1.

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates and Duration
provisions.summary: The Order is effective upon publication on the FTC website and terminates on November 20, 2037, or 20 years from the most recent date the Commission files a complaint alleging a violation, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.

requirements.description: The Order is final and effective upon the date of its publication on the Commission's website (ftc.gov) as a final order
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this Order is final and effective upon the date of its publication on the Commission’s website (ftc.gov) as a final order. This Order will terminate on

requirements.description: The Order terminates on November 20, 2037, or 20 years from the most recent date the United States or the Commission files a complaint in federal court alleging any violation of the Order, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions for shorter provisions, non-defendant respondents, and post-termination filings
requirements.quoted_text: publication on the Commission’s website (ftc.gov) as a final order. This Order will terminate on November 20, 2037, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying settlement) in federal court alleging any violation of the Order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of: A. any Provision in this Order that terminates in less than twenty (20) years; B. this Order’s application to any Respondent that is not named as a defendant in such complaint; and C. this Order if such complaint is filed after the order has terminated pursuant to this Provision. If such complaint is dismissed or a federal court rules that Respondent did not violate any provision of the Order, and the dismissal or ruling is either not appealed or upheld on appeal, then the Order as to Respondent will terminate according to this Provision as though the complaint had never been filed, except that the Order will not terminate between the date such complaint is filed and the later of the deadline for appealing such dismissal or ruling and the date such dismissal or ruling is upheld on appeal.

duration.termination_text: This Order will terminate on November 20, 2037, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying settlement) in federal court alleging any violation of the Order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of: A. any Provision in this Order that terminates in less than twenty (20) years; B. this Order's application to any Respondent that is not named as a defendant in such complaint; and C. this Order if such complaint is filed after the order has terminated pursuant to this Provision. If such complaint is dismissed or a federal court rules that Respondent did not violate any provision of the Order, and the dismissal or ruling is either not appealed or upheld on appeal, then the Order as to Respondent will terminate according to this Provision as though the complaint had never been filed, except that the Order will not terminate between the date such complaint is filed and the later of the deadline for appealing such dismissal or ruling and the date such dismissal or ruling is upheld on appeal.
